- Topic: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement for Transfer of Railroad Properties
- Summary: The ordinance authorizes the Mayor of the City of New Orleans to enter into a Cooperative Endeavor Agreement between the City, the Public Belt Railroad Commission, the Board of Commissioners of the Port of New Orleans, and the New Orleans Public Belt Railroad Corporation for the transfer of all rights, title, and interest in the Commission's properties and assets to the NPC in exchange for the Governor Nicholls and Esplanade Avenue wharves owned by the Port, to enhance economic growth and development of trade and commerce in the City.
- Ordinance Number: M-18-14
- Votes Summary:
   - Vote 1: Approved - (4 YEAS, 3 NAYS, 0 ABSENT, 0 RECUSED)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was approved with 4 council members voting in favor and 3 voting against it.
- Tags/Keywords: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement, Transfer of Railroad Properties, Economic Development, Trade and Commerce
- UID: a57456ab-30a7-48eb-9149-6e33237f7d1e

- Topic: Amendments to Ethics Administration Regulations
- Summary: This ordinance aims to amend and re-ordain the title of Article XIII of Chapter 2 of the City Code, governing Ethics Administration, and to enact revisions mandated by the Home Rule Charter to ensure financial and operational independence of local ethics entities. The ordinance also provides for proper funding apportionment and annual independent external evaluation procedures for each entity. The ordinance was continued for further discussion and potential action.
- Ordinance Number: 31807

- UID: 363ab545-4052-42c9-b5c0-908e010ab5be

- Topic: Funding for Renovations at Norman Playground
- Summary: The ordinance authorizes the Mayor to enter into a second amendment to an existing Cooperative Endeavor Agreement to adjust project funding for renovations at Norman Playground. The funding will consist of $217,300 of Priority I Cash Line of Credit and $2,700 of Priority 5 Non-Cash Line of Credit approved by the Louisiana Bond Commission. The amendment also includes revisions to Articles VIII and XVII of the agreement. The ordinance passed with 7 YEAS and 0 NAYS.

- Topic: Establishment of Mandatory Inclusionary Zoning Overlay District
- Summary: The ordinance aims to institute a mandatory inclusionary zoning requirement via an overlay district in certain areas of the city with disparities in affordable and workforce housing options. The ordinance was continued to the meeting of 6/7/18.

messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 8-23-2018

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Water Disconnect Suspension and Billing Remediation
- Summary: The ordinance directs the Sewerage and Water Board New Orleans to suspend water disconnects until a permanent executive director takes office and develops a plan of remedy within 30 days. It also calls for the creation of an internal process for erroneous bills to be reviewed and resolved, and the implementation of a plan to levelize all bills until billing system issues are rectified. Additionally, it aims to identify approximately 9,000 customers who have not yet received any bill and rectify this oversight.
- Ordinance Number: R-18-375
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Suspend the Rules to introduce Resolution No. on the Council's Agenda - Passed (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSENT)
    - Vote 2: Adopt - Passed (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted, directing the Sewerage and Water Board New Orleans to suspend water disconnects and implement billing remediation measures.
- UID: 74ff1011-408c-4a6b-8ae8-696f13fcd967

- Summary: The ordinance seeks to establish a temporary moratorium on the issuance of permits and licenses relative to Temporary and Commercial Short Term Rentals (STR) to all persons who do not currently hold an existing, valid STR permit/license or a conditional use ordinance that permits a STR at a premises on the effective date of this ordinance. The ordinance was continued to a future meeting.

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment of Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance
- Summary: The ordinance directs the City Planning Commission to conduct a public hearing to consider amending the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance of the City of New Orleans to establish a new Interim Zoning District (IZD) named the Lower Ninth Ward Housing Development IZD. This amendment aims to establish standards for the redevelopment of non-conforming lots in specific areas and make provisions for single-family and two-family residences.
- Ordinance Number: M-18-503
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion was adopted, and the City Planning Commission is directed to conduct a public hearing for the proposed amendment.
- UID: 659c4454-9cad-4b49-bb96-795fd269751d

- Topic: Amending the holiday schedule for City Government for the year 2018

- Summary: The ordinance aims to clarify zoning regulations for properties within an Educational Campus District that are not used in conjunction with an educational facility. It also includes revisions to clarify the applicability and process requirements for Institutional Master Plans.
- Ordinance Number: M-18-163
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted with unanimous support from the council members.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning regulations, Educational Campus District, Institutional Master Plans
- UID: 1b488b4d-66a7-4d2a-b52e-48698bf1ac93

- Topic: City Council Procurement Card Policies and Procedures Manual
- Summary: This ordinance involves the adoption of the "City Council Procurement Card Policies and Procedures Manual."
- Ordinance Number: M-18-165
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The council unanimously adopted the procurement card policies and procedures manual.
- Tags/Keywords: Procurement, Policies, Procedures, Manual
- UID: 1b488b4d-66a7-4d2a-b52e-48698bf1ac93

- Topic: Appointment to Children and Youth Planning Board
- Summary: This ordinance involves the ratification, confirmation, and approval of the appointment of Dr. Roland Bullard as a member of the Children and Youth Planning Board.
- Ordinance Number: M-18-166
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Suspend the Rules - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The council unanimously voted to suspend the rules and approved the appointment of Dr. Roland Bullard to the Children and Youth Planning Board.
- Tags/Keywords: Appointment, Children and Youth Planning Board, Ratification
- UID: 1b488b4d-66a7-4d2a-b52e-48698bf1ac93

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Ratification of Monique Robinson's appointment to the Children and Youth Planning Board
- Summary: The council ratified, confirmed, and approved the appointment of Monique Robinson as a member of the Children and Youth Planning Board, replacing Ann Rabin for a term expiring on June 30, 2019.
- Ordinance Number: M-18-167
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
    Vote 2: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Monique Robinson's appointment to the Children and Youth Planning Board was ratified and confirmed.
- Tags/Keywords: Appointment, Children and Youth Planning Board, Ratification
- UID: e8fff0b8-548e-47da-9d6d-a617934c9106
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 5-3-2018

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Waiving NORDC Facility Rental Fee for Women's Dinner
- Summary: The ordinance proposed waiving the NORDC Facility Rental Fee for the Women's Dinner held on May 2, 2018 at the Treme Recreation Community Center. The fee waiver did not include the facility rental deposit or any direct costs to the city.
- Ordinance Number: M-18-171
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Suspend the Rules - Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 1 ABSENT)
    Vote 2: Adopt - Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion to waive the NORDC Facility Rental Fee for the Women's Dinner was passed with no objections.
- Tags/Keywords: NORDC, Facility Rental Fee, Women's Dinner
- UID: 68298a6e-a25f-479d-8e66-2fb40bd3aee1

- Topic: HDLC Appeal of Justin B. Schmidt
- Summary: The appeal requested to challenge the New Orleans Historic District Landmarks Commission's decision of "denial" of renovation and new construction of buildings on the property at 3000-3032 St. Claude Avenue.
- Ordinance Number: Not specified
- Votes Summary: The appeal was withdrawn.
- Decision/Key Actions: The appeal to challenge the decision of the Historic District Landmarks Commission was withdrawn.
- Tags/Keywords: HDLC Appeal, Historic District Landmarks Commission, Renovation, New Construction
- UID: 68298a6e-a25f-479d-8e66-2fb40bd3aee1
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 5-3-2018

messages.page_content:
- Topic: ZONING DOCKET NO. 21/18 — 3000-3032 St. Claude Ave., LLC
- Summary: Requesting a zoning change from an HMR-3 Historic Marigny/Tremé/Bywater Residential District to an HMC-2 Historic Marigny/Tremé/Bywater Commercial District, as well as a conditional use permit for a hotel over 10,000 square feet in floor area in an HMC-2 district. The recommendation of the City Planning Commission was "FOR DENIAL".
- Ordinance Number: 21/18
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: WITHDRAWN
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was withdrawn before a vote took place.
- UID: 5f0781c3-9690-4fca-8045-d82078680b64
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 5-3-2018

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Ordinance for Zoning Regulation Update
- Summary: The ordinance proposed updates to the city's zoning regulations, aiming to address issues related to land use and development. The council voted and the ordinance passed with 14 YEAS and 5 NAYS.
- Ordinance Number: 7b4fcdba-a847-4e6d-b59a-943e85faaf6a
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (14 YEAS, 5 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 6 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed without any amendments and will now be implemented as part of the city's zoning regulations.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning, Land Use, Development, Regulation
- UID: 7b4fcdba-a847-4e6d-b59a-943e85faaf6a

- Topic: Motion for Public Park Renovation Funding
- Summary: The motion proposed allocating additional funding for the renovation of public parks in the city, aiming to improve recreational spaces for residents. The council voted and the motion passed with 19 YEAS and 0 NAYS.
- Ordinance Number: 7b4fcdba-a847-4e6d-b59a-943e85faaf6a
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (19 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 6 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion passed without any amendments, and the allocated funding will be used for the renovation of public parks.
- Tags/Keywords: Parks, Renovation, Funding, Recreation
- UID: 7b4fcdba-a847-4e6d-b59a-943e85faaf6a
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 5-3-2018

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Zoning Docket No. 21-18
- Summary: The ordinance recommended a zoning change from a residential to a commercial district, which was overruled and granted with conditions. A substitute motion for denial also failed.
- Ordinance Number: ZD NO. 21-18
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Failed - (2 YEAS, 3 NAYS, 2 ABSENT)
    Vote 2: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: The request for the zoning change was granted with conditions, despite the recommendation for denial.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning, Historic District, Commercial, Residential
- UID: dd757f9b-a42a-46e2-8840-5957a7be4025

- Summary: The motion to adjourn the meeting was introduced by Council Member Williams and seconded by Council Member Gray. The vote resulted in 6 YEAS with no NAYS and 1 member, Brossett, being absent.
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion to adjourn the meeting passed.
